intro: Clypeola jonthlaspi f. petraea, commonly known as the rock cress, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is a low-growing perennial that typically thrives in rocky or gravelly soils, often found in alpine or arctic regions. The plant features small, white or yellow flowers arranged in clusters, and its leaves are usually narrow and linear. It is characterized by its ability to withstand harsh environmental conditions, making it a hardy species. The subspecies f. petraea is distinguished by its specific habitat preferences and morphological traits adapted to rocky substrates.
